Reviews.Title: Does more than you expect from this camera
Reviews.Author: Bargain_Hunt
Reviews.Content: It was gift for my Mother-in-law who has difficulty viewing pictures on small screen. I needed some high res. low Maint. camera. This camera has AA battery so no issues there. takes nice pictures when i tested and when used by 60+ year old with little or no training, you have to give 2 Thumbs up to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely stunning close ups!
Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: This little camera absolutely blew me away. I have four other digital cameras from Fujifilm, Nikon and Kodak but this bargain-basement priced camera is better than all of them, and they are not the entry level cameras in their lines like this one is. I've never used a Canon before but I can definitely see why people love them. To be fair though, the zoom range is not very good on this camera compared to many on the market today, but it's perfect if you're going to be doing a lot of close up macro shots or if you're looking for a good cheap camera to start out with that doesn't require advanced knowledge of photography principles. Its focus range is .4 inches to infinity so you can get right up on a subject and get a perfectly sharp and clear picture. It even has a focus assist that fires this little orange beam from right next to the lens that measures the distance to your target and adjusts focus appropriately. The smart auto feature is also extremely handy and very accurate at choosing your shutter, aperture, ISO, and white balance for you. This camera is hands-down the best point and shoot I have ever used, it takes great photos with little to no effort on your part and surpasses even high end consumer models in other manufacturer's product lines. Don't let the low price fool you, this camera will really surprise you with its picture quality.

Reviews.Title: powershot a800
Reviews.Author: bay
Reviews.Content: This was a gift.My girl friend is using it and taking wonderful pictures.Very easy to use and very easy to learn on this camera.Great camera!!!  GB(-:

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Devildog1.0
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my seven year old who loves taking photos. I got tired of being asked constantly to borrow my, more expensive, camera. I bought one of those toy cameras once; it was more than half the price of this one and it broke within a few months. This one is a lot more sturdy and has stood up to some pretty rough handling.Batteries aren't the propietary charge style, which is nice. They're simple AAA batteries; which means you can buy some at any store or get some regular rechargeables.The images are pretty good. And the screen is the perfect size, and decently lit, to assist in composing a decent photo with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for daughter to take to camp
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This has been a super camera for my 11 year old- it is a bit slow but a great one to learn on. Last year she took disposable cameras to camp and did not have any pictures turn out- this year she came home with a bunch of great ones!

Reviews.Title: does the job
Reviews.Author: lela daVia
Reviews.Content: I wanted something with more options to take interesting photos. This one is fine, but I expected something a bit easier to figure out

Reviews.Title: Love the camera!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Curry
Reviews.Content: I love the compact size of the camera we bought for our Grandson.  I also appreciate the rechargeable batteries....especially for him.  The picture quality is very good.  Overall, I'm very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I lovvve taking pictures everywhere I go, and forgot to get one before I ventured on my vacation. I purchased this camera with the intention to make sure I have a one available, and I am actually surprised on how much I like it. For one thing, it arrived 3 days after ordering it (THANK YOU, BTW) and it is very simple to use. Over all, I am pleased. I had to only give it four stars due to the fact that the zoom isn't that great.

Reviews.Title: Cannon powershot 10mp digital camera
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: Super little camera, takes great pictures. I carry it in my purse all the time, its small enough, and I am always ready to take a pic.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good value
Reviews.Author: mizmak
Reviews.Content: Several years ago I bought a camera for over $300. It recently pooped out and I wanted to spend as little as possible on a new one. From the reviews I read on several websites, this Canon A800 seemed to be a good choice. And it is for the most part. The pictures are fine although it sometimes takes a long time to focus and I have to push the button a few times to get it to take a picture. (When I'm trying to take pictures of my black dog, it has a heck of a time locking in on the face.) The other annoying thing is that the batteries don't last nearly as long as some reviewers have stated. The batteries it came with lasted about a month. The second set that I put in only lasted about a week. Now I'm going to have to buy some rechargeable ones. So it's going to end up costing over $100 with the batteries and the memory card that you need to take any pictures at all.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a few days, then Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Howdoyouspellthis
Reviews.Content: Powershot A800 worked for a few days and then started displaying Lens Error every time I turn it on. Then it stopped working all togehter...

Reviews.Title: Lee
Reviews.Author: LJ Leder
Reviews.Content: We received this camera promptly and it was well packed.  We bought it for our granddaughter's birthday, which is next month.  We bought it because of the very good reviews.

Reviews.Title: unfortunate
Reviews.Author: Louis Cardiello Jr. "yanksrule"
Reviews.Content: This new camera out of the box was broken. After powering up the camera, the zoom lense zoomed out all by itself, freezing there. I have 3 other Canon cameras and never had a problem with any of them. This is a first.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Rae
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for vacation and on the third day the focus was completely gone.  Could only see a blurred image in the screen and the last picture taken had lines across it.  Thank goodness my husband had packed another older camera and we didn't miss any pictures.

ProductInfo.Features:
10 effective megapixels, 1/2.3-inch CCD image sensor; 3.3x optical zoom and 4x digital zoom
2.5 in. TFT LCD display; Built-in flash; 640 x 480p video recording
DIGIC III Image Processor; Scene Modes such as Super Vivid, Poster Effect and Blur Reduction
Smart AUTO (19 scenes); Face Detection; Red-eye Correction
USB 2.0 Hi-Speed; SD card slot (card not included)
10.0 megapixels and 3.3x optical zoom
Smart Auto intelligently selects settings from 19 predefined shooting situations
AA battery power enables you to easily power up on the go
Bright, clear 2.5-inch LCD
Scene modes such as Super Vivid, Poster Effect and Blur Reduction
ProductInfo.Name: Canon Powershot A800 10 MP Digital Camera with 3.3x Optical Zoom (Red)
